alert.note: Alert for Kingfisher (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 8:31PM CDT until July 10 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Kingfisher Creek near Kingfisher affecting Kingfisher County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Kingfisher Creek near Kingfisher. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Expect near-bankfull creek levels west of the city of Kingfisher. Some agricultural fields and low-lying roads west of Kingfisher may be briefly flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT the stage was estimated at 17.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The Kingfisher Creek is expected to fall. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. Monday morning at 845 AM CDT.
